subject: Business
title: Diversification: Don't Put All Eggs in One Basket
description: Learn Diversification: Don't Put All Eggs in One Basket in one minute.

hook.text: Enron employees had 62% of their 401(k) in Enron stock. When the company collapsed, they lost their jobs and savings.

buildup.text: Diversification means spreading investments across different assets so no single failure can wipe you out.

discovery.text: A mix of stocks, bonds, real estate, and international investments reduces overall risk without proportionally reducing.

twist.text: Over-diversification exists too. Owning 500 stocks gives little additional benefit over 30 well-chosen ones.

climax.text: Nobel laureate Harry Markowitz called diversification 'the only free lunch in finance.' Risk drops, returns hold.

punchline.text: Concentration builds wealth. Diversification protects it.

quiz.question: Why did Harry Markowitz call diversification 'the only free lunch in finance'?
options: It reduces risk without proportionally reducing returns
It guarantees higher returns than any single stock
